summary: This document is an email chain between defense attorney Bobbi C. Sternheim and prosecutors regarding scheduling the trial for United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell. The prosecution proposes a November 29, 2021 trial date and discusses deadlines for disclosing victim identities and expert reports. The defense pushes for an earlier November 8th start date, citing Maxwell's detention and health.

persons.name: Bobbi C. Sternheim
persons.context: Attorney representing Ghislaine Maxwell, corresponding with prosecutors to schedule the trial and advocate for an earlier start date due to Maxwell's detention.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The accused in the criminal case United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell. Her defense cites her extended detention and its effect on her health as a reason to expedite the trial.

persons.name: Laura Menninger
persons.context: Co-counsel for Ghislaine Maxwell, mentioned as having a scheduling conflict with a civil trial in December.

persons.name: Jeff Pagliuca
persons.context: Co-counsel for Ghislaine Maxwell, copied on the scheduling correspondence.

persons.name: Christian Everdell
persons.context: A prosecutor on the government's team, involved in the email chain to confer on trial scheduling.

connections.description: Sternheim is the lead defense attorney representing Maxwell in her criminal case, advocating for her trial schedule and release.
Both are defense attorneys on Ghislaine Maxwell's legal team, coordinating schedules and trial strategy.
Both are defense attorneys on Ghislaine Maxwell's legal team, copied on scheduling correspondence.
Sternheim (defense) and Everdell (prosecution) are corresponding as opposing counsel to schedule the trial in United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell.

events.title: Proposed Trial Start Date
events.description: The prosecution proposes November 29, 2021, as the start date for the trial of Ghislaine Maxwell, after considering witness and counsel availability.

events.title: Defense's Preferred Trial Start Date
events.description: The defense states November 8, 2021, is their earliest and preferred trial start date, citing Maxwell's extended detention and its effect on her health.

events.title: Laura Menninger's Civil Trial
events.description: Defense attorney Laura Menninger has a conflicting civil trial scheduled for December 13, 2021, which she will try to move.

events.title: Defense Letter-Motion Filed
events.description: The defense filed a letter-motion (Docket 246) detailing their position, including their preference for a November 8th trial date.

locations: West 19th Street office (Law Offices of Bobbi C. Sternheim, mentioned as closed due to Covid-19)
keyFacts: The prosecution proposed a November 29, 2021 trial date for Ghislaine Maxwell, while the defense pushed for a November 8, 2021 start.
The defense cited Ghislaine Maxwell's 'extended period of detention and its deleterious effect on her health and well-being' as a reason not to agree to a date far beyond November 8th.
The prosecution intended to propose disclosing the identities of victims referenced in the indictment three months before trial, an earlier timeline than previously proposed.
The email chain shows active scheduling negotiations between the defense and prosecution in May 2021, several months before the eventual trial.
The correspondence references the Speedy Trial Act and the need for potential time exclusions due to the adjournment.
